result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert D Barndollar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

records.addlTxt: & Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Robert D Barndollar in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:09 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Constable states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - No contest 
Count 3 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has complied with victim notification; victim does not appear in Court today.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Counts 2 & 3 and Count 1 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement on his behalf prior to sentencing.
No restitution requested by the victim.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - DRI

Count 2 -
Impose/Stay a 60 day jail sentence 
Placed on probation for 18 months
Pay costs including domestic abuse surcharge and DNA surcharge
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
No abusive contact with Rebecca Disher
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
1 day jail credit 

Count 3 -
Impose/Stay a 60 day jail sentence concurrent to Count 2 
Placed on probation for 18 months to run concurrent to Count 2 
Comply with conditions in Count 2
Pay costs which include domestic abuse surcharge 
DNA surcharge not imposed on Count 3
